text.div:
Interpretation Codes

Code Description Deutsch (German) Nederlands (Dutch) Comment Version
< Off scale low Unter Meßbereich (Extremwertverletzung) Onder absolute ondergrens instrumentschaal The result is below the minimum detection limit (the test procedure or equipment is the limiting factor).<p>Synonyms: Below analytical limit, low off scale from v2.1
> Off scale high Über Meßbereich (Extremwertverletzung) Boven absolute bovengrens instrumentschaal The result is above the maximum quantifiable limit (the test procedure or equipment is the limiting factor).<p>Synonyms: Above analytical limit, high off scale added v2.2
A Abnormal anormal (nicht numerisch) Abnormaal The result or observation value is outside the reference range or expected norm (as defined for the respective test procedure).<p>Note: Typically applies to non-numeric results. from v2.1
AA Critically abnormal Pathologisch (nicht numerisch) Kritiek abnormaal The result or observation value is outside a reference range or expected norm at a level at which immediate action should be considered for patient safety (as defined for the respective test procedure).<p>[Note: Typically applies to non-numeric results. from v2.1
AC Anti-complementary substances present Anti-complementaire stoffen aanwezig Deprecated added v2.7
B Better Verbesserung Beter The current result or observation value has improved compared to the previous result or observation value (the change is significant as defined in the respective test procedure).<p>Note: This can be applied to quantitative or qualitative observations. added v2.2
D Significant change down Deutlicher Trend nach unten Significante wijzging omlaag The current result has decreased from the previous result for a quantitative observation (the change is significant as defined in the respective test procedure). from v2.1
DET Detected Gedetecteerd The measurement of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign above the limit of detection of the performed test or procedure. added v2.7
H High Oberhalb oberer Grenze Referenzbereich Hoog The result for a quantitative observation is above the upper limit of the reference range (as defined for the respective test procedure).<p>Synonym: Above high normal from v2.1
HH Critically high Oberhalb oberer pathologischer Grenze Kritiek hoog The result for a quantitative observation is above a reference level at which immediate action should be considered for patient safety (as defined for the respective test procedure).<p>Synonym: Above upper panic limits from v2.1
HM Hold for Medical Review Vastgehouden voor medische review Deprecated added v2.8
HU Very high Zeer hoog Significantly high: A test result that is significantly higher than the reference (normal) or therapeutic interval, butÂ has not reached theÂ criticallyÂ high valueÂ andÂ might need special attention, as defined by the laboratory or the clinician.<p>Note: added v2.8.2
I Intermediate Intermediär Gemiddeld Bacterial strain inhibited in vitro by a<p>concentration of an antimicrobial agent that is associated with<p>uncertain therapeutic effect.<p>Reference: CLSI (http://www.clsi.org/Content/NavigationMenu/Resources/HarmonizedTerminologyDatabase/Harmonized_Ter from v2.1
IE Insufficient evidence Onvoldoende bewijs There is insufficient evidence that the species in question is a good target for therapy with the drug. A categorical interpretation is not possible.<p>Reference: EUCAST<p>Note: A MIC with "IE" and/or a comment may be reported (without an accompanying S, added v2.8.2
IND Indeterminate Onbepaald The specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign could neither be declared positive / negative or detected / not detected by the performed test or procedure. added v2.7
L Low Unterhalb unterer Grenze Referenzbereich Laag The result for a quantitative observation is below the lower limit of the reference range (as defined for the respective test procedure).<p>Synonym: Below low normal added v2.2
LL Critically low Unterhalb unterer pathologischer Grenze Kritiek laag The result for a quantitative observation is below a reference level at which immediate action should be considered for patient safety (as defined for the respective test procedure).<p>Synonym: Below lower panic limits from v2.1
LU Very low Zeer laag Significantly low: A test result that is significantly lower than the reference (normal) or therapeutic interval, butÂ has not reached theÂ criticallyÂ low valueÂ andÂ mightÂ need special attention, as defined by the laboratory or the clinician.<p>Note: T added v2.8.2
MS Moderately susceptible. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only. mäßig empfindlich Gemiddeld gevoelig. Alleen voor microbiologische gevoeligheid. Deprecated - CLSI now only supports S, I & R. This information can be found in CLSI document M100-S22; Vol. 32 No.3; CLSI Performance<p>Standards for Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing; Twenty-Second Informational Supplement. Jan 2012. from v2.1
N Normal Normal (nicht numerisch) Normaal The result or observation value is within the reference range or expected norm (as defined for the respective test procedure).<p>Note: Applies to numeric or non-numeric results. added v2.2
ND Not Detected Niet-gedetecteerd The presence of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign could not be determined within the limit of detection of the performed test or procedure. added v2.7
NEG Negative Negatief An absence finding of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign based on the established threshold of the performed test or procedure.<p>Note: Negative does not necessarily imply the complete absence of the specified item. added v2.7
NR Non-reactive Niet-reactief An absence finding used to indicate that the specified component / analyte did not react measurably with the reagent. added v2.7
NS Non-susceptible Niet-gevoelig A category used for isolates for which only a susceptible interpretive criterion has been designated because of the absence or rare occurrence of resistant strains. Isolates that have MICs above or zone diameters below the value indicated for the suscepti added v2.8.2
OBX Interpretation qualifiers in separate OBX segments Interpretatie qualifiers in afzonderlijke OBX-segmenten Deprecated added v2.8
POS Positive Positief A presence finding of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign based on the established threshold of the performed test or procedure. added v2.7
QCF Quality Control Failure Kwaliteitscontrole fout Deprecated added v2.7
R Resistant Resistent Resistent Bacterial strain inhibited in vitro by a concentration of an antimicrobial agent that is associated with a high likelihood of therapeutic failure.<p>Reference: CLSI (http://www.clsi.org/Content/NavigationMenu/Resources/HarmonizedTerminologyDatabase/Harmon from v2.1
RR Reactive Reactief A presence finding used to indicate that the specified component / analyte reacted with the reagent above the reliably measurable limit of the performed test. added v2.7
S Susceptible Empfindlich Gevoelig Bacterial strain inhibited by in vitro concentration of an antimicrobial agent that is associated with a high likelihood of therapeutic success.<p>Reference: CLSI (http://www.clsi.org/Content/NavigationMenu/Resources/HarmonizedTerminologyDatabase/Harmoniz from v2.1
SDD Susceptible-dose dependent Gevoelig dosis-afhankelijk A category that includes isolates with antimicrobial agent minimum inhibitory concentrations (MICs) that approach usually attainable blood and tissue levels and for which response rates may be lower than for susceptible isolates.<p>Reference: CLSI documen added v2.8.2
SYN-R Synergy - resistant Synergie - resistent A category for isolates where the bacteria (e.g. enterococci) are not susceptible in vitro to a combination therapy (e.g. high-level aminoglycoside and cell wall active agent). This is predictive that this combination therapy will not be effective.<p>Usa added v2.8.2
SYN-S Synergy - susceptible Synergie - gevoelig A category for isolates where the bacteria (e.g. enterococci) are susceptible in vitro to a combination therapy (e.g. high-level aminoglycoside and cell wall active agent). This is predictive that this combination therapy will be effective.<p>Usage Note: added v2.8.2
TOX Cytotoxic substance present Cytotoxische stoffen aanwezig Deprecated added v2.7
U Significant change up Deutlicher Trend nach oben Significante wijzging omhoog The current result has increased from the previous result for a quantitative observation (the change is significant as defined in the respective test procedure). from v2.1
VS Very susceptible. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only. Sehr empfindlich Zeer gevoelig. Alleen voor microbiologische gevoeligheid. Deprecated - CLSI now only supports S, I & R. This information can be found in CLSI document M100-S22; Vol. 32 No.3; CLSI Performance<p>Standards for Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing; Twenty-Second Informational Supplement. Jan 2012. from v2.1
W Worse Verschlechterung Slechter The current result or observation value has degraded compared to the previous result or observation value (the change is significant as defined in the respective test procedure).<p>Note: This can be applied to quantitative or qualitative observations. added v2.2
WR Weakly reactive Zwak reactief A weighted presence finding used to indicate that the specified component / analyte reacted with the reagent, but below the reliably measurable limit of the performed test. added v2.7
null No range defined, or normal ranges don't apply Kein Referenzbereich / Referenzbereich nicht anwendbar Geen referentiewaarden gedefinieerd of normale waarden niet van toepassing Deprecated from v2.1

name: v2 Interpretation Codes
description: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0078 ( Interpretation Codes)

extension.valueString:
The result is below the minimum detection limit (the test procedure or equipment is the limiting factor).

Synonyms: Below analytical limit, low off scale

The result is above the maximum quantifiable limit (the test procedure or equipment is the limiting factor).

Synonyms: Above analytical limit, high off scale

The result or observation value is outside the reference range or expected norm (as defined for the respective test procedure).

Note: Typically applies to non-numeric results.

The result or observation value is outside a reference range or expected norm at a level at which immediate action should be considered for patient safety (as defined for the respective test procedure).

[Note: Typically applies to non-numeric results.
Deprecated

The current result or observation value has improved compared to the previous result or observation value (the change is significant as defined in the respective test procedure).

Note: This can be applied to quantitative or qualitative observations.
The current result has decreased from the previous result for a quantitative observation (the change is significant as defined in the respective test procedure).
The measurement of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign above the limit of detection of the performed test or procedure.

The result for a quantitative observation is above the upper limit of the reference range (as defined for the respective test procedure).

Synonym: Above high normal

The result for a quantitative observation is above a reference level at which immediate action should be considered for patient safety (as defined for the respective test procedure).

Synonym: Above upper panic limits
Deprecated

Significantly high: A test result that is significantly higher than the reference (normal) or therapeutic interval, butÂ has not reached theÂ criticallyÂ high valueÂ andÂ might need special attention, as defined by the laboratory or the clinician.

Note:

Bacterial strain inhibited in vitro by a

concentration of an antimicrobial agent that is associated with

uncertain therapeutic effect.

Reference: CLSI (http://www.clsi.org/Content/NavigationMenu/Resources/HarmonizedTerminologyDatabase/Harmonized_Ter

There is insufficient evidence that the species in question is a good target for therapy with the drug. A categorical interpretation is not possible.

Reference: EUCAST

Note: A MIC with "IE" and/or a comment may be reported (without an accompanying S,
The specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign could neither be declared positive / negative or detected / not detected by the performed test or procedure.

The result for a quantitative observation is below the lower limit of the reference range (as defined for the respective test procedure).

Synonym: Below low normal

The result for a quantitative observation is below a reference level at which immediate action should be considered for patient safety (as defined for the respective test procedure).

Synonym: Below lower panic limits

Significantly low: A test result that is significantly lower than the reference (normal) or therapeutic interval, butÂ has not reached theÂ criticallyÂ low valueÂ andÂ mightÂ need special attention, as defined by the laboratory or the clinician.

Note: T

Deprecated - CLSI now only supports S, I & R. This information can be found in CLSI document M100-S22; Vol. 32 No.3; CLSI Performance

Standards for Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing; Twenty-Second Informational Supplement. Jan 2012.

concept.display: Moderately susceptible. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.

designation.value: Gemiddeld gevoelig. Alleen voor microbiologische gevoeligheid.

extension.valueString:
The result or observation value is within the reference range or expected norm (as defined for the respective test procedure).

Note: Applies to numeric or non-numeric results.
The presence of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign could not be determined  within the limit of detection of the performed test or procedure.

An absence finding of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign based on the established threshold of the performed test or procedure.

Note: Negative does not necessarily imply the complete absence of the specified item.
An absence finding used to indicate that the specified component / analyte did not react measurably with the reagent.

A category used for isolates for which only a susceptible interpretive criterion has been designated because of the absence or rare occurrence of resistant strains. Isolates that have MICs above or zone diameters below the value indicated for the suscepti
Deprecated

concept.display: Interpretation qualifiers in separate OBX segments

extension.valueString: A presence finding of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign based on the established threshold of the performed test or procedure.
Deprecated

Bacterial strain inhibited in vitro by a concentration of an antimicrobial agent that is associated with a high likelihood of therapeutic failure.

Reference: CLSI (http://www.clsi.org/Content/NavigationMenu/Resources/HarmonizedTerminologyDatabase/Harmon
A presence finding used to indicate that the specified component / analyte reacted with the reagent above the reliably measurable limit of the performed test.

Bacterial strain inhibited by in vitro concentration of an antimicrobial agent that is associated with a high likelihood of therapeutic success.

Reference: CLSI (http://www.clsi.org/Content/NavigationMenu/Resources/HarmonizedTerminologyDatabase/Harmoniz

A category that includes isolates with antimicrobial agent minimum inhibitory concentrations (MICs) that approach usually attainable blood and tissue levels and for which response rates may be lower than for susceptible isolates.

Reference: CLSI documen

A category for isolates where the bacteria (e.g. enterococci) are not susceptible in vitro to a combination therapy (e.g. high-level aminoglycoside and cell wall active agent). This is predictive that this combination therapy will not be effective.

Usa

A category for isolates where the bacteria (e.g. enterococci) are susceptible in vitro to a combination therapy (e.g. high-level aminoglycoside and cell wall active agent). This is predictive that this combination therapy will be effective.

Usage Note:
Deprecated
The current result has increased from the previous result for a quantitative observation (the change is significant as defined in the respective test procedure).

Deprecated - CLSI now only supports S, I & R. This information can be found in CLSI document M100-S22; Vol. 32 No.3; CLSI Performance

Standards for Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing; Twenty-Second Informational Supplement. Jan 2012.

concept.display: Very susceptible. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.

designation.value: Zeer gevoelig. Alleen voor microbiologische gevoeligheid.

extension.valueString:
The current result or observation value has degraded compared to the previous result or observation value (the change is significant as defined in the respective test procedure).

Note: This can be applied to quantitative or qualitative observations.
A weighted presence finding used to indicate that the specified component / analyte reacted with the reagent, but below the reliably measurable limit of the performed test.
Deprecated

concept.display: No range defined, or normal ranges don't apply

designation.value: Geen referentiewaarden gedefinieerd of normale waarden niet van toepassing
